page.title: 20HOME LIFE STAPEHILL
page.content: {Stapehill}is a small village between Wimborne and{Ferndown.}The only shops are a Post Office, village store, butcher, farm shop and hairdresser. Many village people depend on these shops for food, because they are unable to get to Ferndown. The{village {hall}is much used by the community for playgroups, meetings (of the Women's Institute for example), polling station, local amateur theatrical productions, fetes and fairs, concerts and bingo. Many of the older residents use the hall regularly as it is a good meeting place. It is nearly always booked for various events or clubs. Polden's Nurseries are between Stapehill and Ferndown. Mr Polden Snr died in 1982 and now his son runs the business, manufacturing compost and selling it, also seeds, to garden centres, as well as to the public.
